item.title: Use VSCode for LaTeX
item.description: VSCode for LaTeX Prepare your system I am using Ubuntu 18.04 that runs on my Windows 10 PC with the Windows Subsystem for Linux 2 (WSL 2). If you also use Windows 10, I recommend using the following resources to set up WSL 2: Windows Subsystem for Linux Installation Guide for Windows 10 The Complete Developer’s Guide to Windows Subsystem for Linux 2 For a quick start, we will use the VSCode “Remote Containers” extension.

item.title: Use applications with intention
item.description: We couldn’t reach the information we wanted a long time ago. While that’s no longer the case, today, we struggle with different problems: Maintaining focus and discovering critical information in noise and clutter. Here I share some of the tricks I employ to overcome these problems. My intention is to update this post, adding more apps and tips. Web browsers Be careful about the amount of time you spend on web sites, especially the addictive ones.

item.title: Planning vs Preparation
item.description: You do planning to design the set of actions to achieve a goal. You do preparation to get ready for some future goal. Both are important. But the famous quote goes: “Everybody has a plan until they get punched in the mouth.” If your plans need to change during execution, the number of required modifications, and how well you carry out those modifications depend on your preparation.
